Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that absentee voters have "no way" to know if ballots are delivered, when in fact there is a method provided by election officials for voters to track their ballots.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that there is a method available for voters to track their ballots, although it acknowledges that it may be an obstacle for some voters.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the assertion that absentee voters have "no way" to know if ballots are delivered.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that absentee voters have no means of tracking their ballots, without considering the method provided by election officials.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that while there is a method for voters to track their ballots, it may not be accessible or feasible for all voters.
